org.netbeans.spi.java.hints

Class JavaFix

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.netbeans.spi.java.hints.JavaFix

  • public abstract class JavaFix
extends Object
    A base class for fixes that modify Java source code. Using this class as a base class makes creating the fix somewhat simpler, but also supports running the hint in the Inspect&Transform dialog. The fix can be converted to Fix by means of the toEditorFix() method.
    See Also:
    for various predefined fixes.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  JavaFix.TransformationContext
      A context that contains a reference to a WorkingCopy through which modifications of Java source code can be made.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JavaFix

        protected JavaFix(@NonNull
                  CompilationInfo info,
                  @NonNull
                  TreePath tp)
        Create JavaFix with the given base TreePath. The base TreePath will be passed back to the real implementation of the fix.
        Parameters:
        info - a CompilationInfo from which the given TreePath originates
        tp - a TreePath that will be passed back to the performRewrite(org.netbeans.spi.java.hints.JavaFix.TransformationContext) method

      • JavaFix

        protected JavaFix(@NonNull
                  CompilationInfo info,
                  @NonNull
                  TreePath tp,
                  @NullAllowed
                  String sortText)
        Create JavaFix with the given base TreePath. The base TreePath will be passed back to the real implementation of the fix.
        Parameters:
        info - a CompilationInfo from which the given TreePath originates
        tp - a TreePath that will be passed back to the performRewrite(org.netbeans.spi.java.hints.JavaFix.TransformationContext) method
        sortText - if non-null, fix returned from toEditorFix() will be an EnhancedFix, and the given sortText will be returned from its EnhancedFix.getSortText().
        Since:
        1.18

      • JavaFix

        protected JavaFix(@NonNull
                  TreePathHandle handle)
        Create JavaFix with the given base TreePathHandle. The base TreePathHandle will be resolved and passed back to the real implementation of the fix.
        Parameters:
        handle - a TreePathHandle that will be resolved and passed back to the performRewrite(org.netbeans.spi.java.hints.JavaFix.TransformationContext) method

      • JavaFix

        protected JavaFix(@NonNull
                  TreePathHandle handle,
                  @NullAllowed
                  String sortText)
        Create JavaFix with the given base TreePathHandle. The base TreePathHandle will be resolved and passed back to the real implementation of the fix.
        Parameters:
        handle - a TreePathHandle that will be resolved and passed back to the performRewrite(org.netbeans.spi.java.hints.JavaFix.TransformationContext) method
        sortText - if non-null, fix returned from toEditorFix() will be an EnhancedFix, and the given sortText will be returned from its EnhancedFix.getSortText().
        Since:
        1.18

    • Method Detail

      • getText

        @NonNull
protected abstract String getText()
        The display text of the fix.
        Returns:
        the display text of the fix.

      • performRewrite

        protected abstract void performRewrite(@NonNull
                                       JavaFix.TransformationContext ctx)
                                throws Exception
        Do the transformations needed to implement the hint's function.
        Parameters:
        ctx - a context over which the fix should operate
        Throws:
        Exception - if something goes wrong while performing the transformation - will be logged by the infrastructure

      • toEditorFix

        public final Fix toEditorFix()
        Convert this JavaFix into the Editor Hints Fix.
        Returns:
        a Fix, that when invoked, will invoke performRewrite(org.netbeans.spi.java.hints.JavaFix.TransformationContext) method on this JavaFix.
